content.description: A splitter hand-to-offwidth crack on a large boulder.  This route is immediately to the left of "The Scarecrow" (2 bolt 5.10).  Many brittle flakes on the face alongside the crack.
content.protection: A few pieces 2 to 5" if you actually lead this route. Makes for a fun easy solo with an quick walkoff if you're already in the area for other climbs.

content.description:
From the ground climb the horizontal off-width crack 5.12, or from the top of

a boulder Swing onto the overhanging left leaning

off-width

11C and layback up to hand jams, then fingerlocks to face holds.
content.protection: Extra wide cams to small tcu’s
content.location: With your back to Off To See The Wizard you cant miss this obvious wide crack in a wildly overhanging alcove.

climbs.name: Mr. Brownstone
climbs.fa: (TR) Scott Cosgrove, 1994; First Lead: Charlie Barrett

content.description:
The thin overhanging offset seam on the north side of the first big boulder at the bottom of the wash.

Originally called "The Golden Triangle".
content.location: The thin overhanging offset seam on the north side of the first big boulder at the bottom of the wash.

content.description: Hard boulder problem start followed by 5.12 climbing.  Lots of fun.  Best in cold conditions.
content.location: Oz area in the Poppy Field Boulders.  On same boulder as "Off to See the Wizard", which is route #3446 in the old 1992 Vogel guide.

content.description: Thin edges and undercling features up a nice slab.  Route meanders a little to the left than a little to the right and finishes straight up.
content.location: This route is just left of Baum's Away and shares the same anchor.

content.description: A steep Arete leading to a long easy slab.
content.location: Just around the corner from Poppycock on the same formation
